meanings.definition: To run quickly with light steps
meanings.sent1: The little rabbit scampered across the field to reach its burrow.
meanings.sent2: The children scampered around the playground, full of energy and joy.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel scampered up the tree, carrying an acorn in its mouth.
meanings.sent4: The wind scampered through the leaves, creating a rustling sound in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The puppy scampered after its tail, trying to catch it in a playful chase.

meanings.definition: To hurry off or run away, especially playfully or mischievously
meanings.sent1: The cat scampered away when it heard the sound of the vacuum cleaner.
meanings.sent2: The children scampered off to hide during the game of hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon scampered off with the picnic basket, causing a commotion.
meanings.sent4: The shadows scampered across the wall as the clouds moved swiftly in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The playful kittens scampered around the room, chasing each other in circles.
